intro: Euphoria gardneri, commonly known as the Gardner's euphoria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of California. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
